DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to learn how effective each of the two dressings, Silverlon速 and AQUACEL速 AG, are in preventing post cardiac implantable electronic devices (CIED) procedure wound infections.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Outcomes Between the Use of Silverlon速 Dressing and AQUACEL速 AG Dressing Post Cardiac Device Implant
DOC.detailed_description: This is a single center, prospective, 2-arm randomized, non-blinded study. A total of 100 participants will be assigned to the Silverlon arm and 100 to the AQUACEL AG arm. The number of procedures to implant CIED has risen in recent years. With this rise has also brought a rise in post-procedure infections. Infections will happen and there is a continued need to improve all aspects of the surgery and post-operative care. Wound coverage with appropriate dressings is one aspect that needs to be studied in CIED implant patients. Silverlon and AQUACEL AG are two options of dressings available for these patients. This study will look to see if one of the two is a better option for post-operative CIED implant patients.
DOC.criteria: Patients who are scheduled for a CIED implant, generator change, or upgrade at the University of Kansas Hospital Able to give informed consent Patients who are already on antibiotics for another reasons Immunocompromised patients such as those on immunosuppressant's and HIV positive patients Patients who are post device explant for lead infection Patients with an allergy to adhesive, silver or an allergy to the dressing(s) or their components
